metadata.title: CVE-2014-5044 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in libgfortran might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (Fortran applicationcrash) via vectors related to array allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 20140715-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gcc-arm-none-eabi - 15:9-2019-q4-0ubuntu1
gcc-arm-none-eabi-source - 15:9-2019-q4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

g++-mingw-w64 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
gcc-mingw-w64 - 16
gcc-mingw-w64-base - 16
gcc-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
gcc-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
gfortran-mingw-w64 - 16
gfortran-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
gfortran-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
gnat-mingw-w64 - 16
gnat-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
gnat-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
gobjc++-mingw-w64 - 16
gobjc++-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
gobjc++-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
gobjc-mingw-w64 - 16
gobjc-mingw-w64-i686 - 16
gobjc-mingw-w64-x86-64 - 16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20140715-0ubuntu1').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15:9-2019-q4-0ubuntu1').
gcc-mingw-w64 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '16').
